content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at approx (2.5, 16.5)
Consists of:
• A cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• A burner inserter (“new factory burner inserter”) at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
• A dedicated burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT (serving the factory interface)
• A burner inserter fueled with coal at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) (in a waiting-for-source-items state)
• An assembling-machine-1 at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) (for copper-cable production)

### Depot Belt Structure at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• A depot wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) to serve as a belt depot
• A dedicated depot burner inserter placed adjacent at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP
• A transport belt segment positioned at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) linking to the depot chest

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• An extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
• A steam engine (generator) at Position(x=–0.5, y=24.5)
• A boiler at Position(x=–5.5, y=24.0)
• An offshore pump at Position(x=–7.5, y=25.5)

### Ore Processing Unit
Consists of:
• A stone furnace producing iron-plate at Position(x=–3.0, y=19.0)
• A stone furnace producing copper-plate at Position(x=–4.0, y=21.0)
• A storage chest at Position(x=–5.5, y=21.5)
• An additional storage chest at Position(x=1.5, y=21.5)
• A burner inserter at Position(x=0.5, y=21.5) (supporting material transfer)
• A burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=23.5) (integrated into the material flow)

### Research Facility
Consists of:
• A lab configured with lab_input {automation‐science‐pack: 17} and electrical_id=7106

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Issues – When connecting transport belts, the target was repeatedly identified as a Prototype.SteamEngine. To resolve this, use an inserter that inputs items into the steam engine rather than connecting the belt directly.
• Placement Distance Problems – Placement attempts for entities such as wooden chests failed when the player was too far from the target point. Ensure the player is within the maximum allowed range (≈10 units) before placing an entity.
• Undefined Variable Errors – A NameError arose from referencing an undefined variable (e.g. “target_chest”). Verify that all variables are properly defined and referenced.
• Inventory Shortage – Placement failures occurred because required items (for example, a wooden chest) were not present in the inventory. Confirm that the necessary items are available before proceeding with placement operations.
